articles.author: Sinead Cruise, Iain Withers, Lawrence White
articles.description: A mix of global economic unease and geopolitical uncertainty means optimism is in short supply among bankers from the City of London to Frankfurt's 'Mainhattan' financial district.
articles.title: Job cuts, lean bonuses loom over Europe's bankers in 2024

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The broad-based downturn in euro zone manufacturing activity eased slightly last month but the sector remained deeply rooted in contractionary territory, prompting factories to trim staffing levels for a sixth straight month.
articles.title: Euro zone factory downturn eased a touch in November -PMI

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Market capitalisations of global mega-cap companies, led by prominent technology firms, surged in November, buoyed by a decline in U.S. yields and growing anticipation of potential rate cuts by global central banks amid diminishing worries about inflation.
articles.title: Tech giants lead surge in global mega-caps as inflation eases

articles.author: Yoruk Bahceli, Dhara Ranasinghe, Naomi Rovnick
articles.description: A stellar rally in equities and bonds suggests market confidence is high for the world economy to reach a soft landing after a run of aggressive interest rate hikes.
articles.title: Markets pin hopes on soft landing, with one eye on recession risk

articles.author: Chavi Mehta
articles.description: More advertisers are likely to flee Elon Musk's social media platform X after the billionaire lashed out at some of the biggest names in the media industry at a New York Times DealBook event for dropping out of the platform, analysts said on Thursday.
articles.title: Analysts predict more brands will flee X after Musk tirade

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Oil prices pared losses on Friday, after falling sharply in early trade and by over 2% on Thursday on perceptions that the voluntary oil output cuts agreed by OPEC+ producers were underwhelming.
articles.title: Oil prices recover from slump after underwhelming OPEC+ cuts

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A group of offshore creditors to China Evergrande Group (3333.HK) is asking for a controlling equity stake of the developer and two of its Hong Kong subsidiaries as part of company's revised debt restructuring proposal, a source familiar with the matter said on Friday.
articles.title: China Evergrande creditors seek controlling stakes in new proposal

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi, Mohammad Salem, Humeyra Pamuk
articles.description: Israel's military said it intercepted a rocket fired from Gaza early on Friday while Hamas-affiliated media reported sounds of gunfire and explosions in the north of the coastal strip shortly before a deadline to extend a seven-day truce was set to expire.
articles.title: Israel intercepts rocket as gunfire, explosions in north Gaza reported

articles.author: Simon Lewis, David Brunnstrom, Trevor Hunnicutt
articles.description: A brazen murder-for-hire plot against a U.S. citizen, which authorities say was directed by an Indian government official, outwardly seems like a development that could upend the fragile new U.S.-India partnership.
articles.title: Why a murder plot will not turn the US away from India

articles.author: Andrew Silver
articles.description: A request by the World Health Organization for more information on a surge in respiratory illnesses and clusters of pneumonia in children in China has attracted global attention.
articles.title: What do we know about China’s respiratory illness surge?
